term.longtitle: IUPAC Gold Book - separated flame in flame spectroscopy
term.title: separated flame

item.text: In a premix burner, sometimes provision is made to screen the observed portion of the flame gases from direct contact with the surrounding air. This may be done either mechanically by placing a tube on top of the burner around the flame, which produces a zonal separation (separated flame), or aerodynamically by surrounding the flame with a sheath of inert gas that emerges from openings at the rim of the burner top (shielded flame).
